info.headline: Snow Squall Warning issued January 14 at 11:28AM EST until January 14 at 12:30PM EST by NWS Albany
info.description: The National Weather Service in Albany has issued a * Snow Squall Warning for... Southern Hamilton County in eastern New York... Northwestern Warren County in east central New York... Fulton County in eastern New York... Northwestern Saratoga County in east central New York... Northern Schoharie County in east central New York... Southern Herkimer County in eastern New York... Western Montgomery County in eastern New York... * Until 1230 PM EST. * At 1126 AM EST, a dangerous snow squall was located along a line extending from 7 miles northwest of Minerva to near West Winfield, moving northeast at 40 mph. HAZARD...Intense bursts of heavy snow. Gusty winds leading to blowing snow and visibility rapidly falling to less than one-quarter mile. Wind gusts up to 35 mph. SOURCE...Radar and webcams. IMPACT...Travel will become difficult and potentially dangerous within minutes. This includes the following highways... Interstate 90 between exits 29 and 30. Interstate 87 near exit 26. Locations impacted include... Gloversville, Johnstown, Ilion, Herkimer, Little Falls, Canajoharie, Indian Lake, Speculator, Mohawk, Frankfort, Johnsburg, Fort Plain, Dolgeville, St. Johnsville, Ephratah, West Winfield, Lake Pleasant, Wells, Newport, and Stratford. PRECAUTIONARY/PREPAREDNESS ACTIONS... Reduce speed and turn on headlights! During snow squalls, the visibility may suddenly drop to near zero in whiteout conditions. There is no safe place on a highway when a snow squall hits. Visibility and traction are immediately lost in whiteout conditions, making it difficult or impossible to slow down and avoid stopped vehicles. Delay travel or safely exit the highway before the snow squall arrives. SNOW SQUALL...OBSERVED
